channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Robredo on pardon: Is it fair and just?
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: President Duterte’s granting of absolute pardon to US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, who was convicted of homicide for the death of transgender Jennifer Laude in 2015, proves his administration’s bias toward the “powerful,” Vice President Leni Robredo said yesterday.

item.title: Pemberton release process ‘expedited’
item.author: Ralph Edwin Villanueva
item.description: There is no need for deportation proceedings, and fresh fingerprints, mug shots and even a COVID swab test have been taken as the government “expedites” the release of homicide convict US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton.

item.title: Concepcion eyes saliva test to help tourism sector
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Presidential Adviser for Entrepreneurship and Go Negosyo founder Joey Concepcion is looking at the use of saliva tests for COVID-19 as part of the measures to be implemented for the safe opening of the tourism industry.

item.title: Año wants end to COVID-19 home quarantine
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) does not favor the home quarantine policy for people infected with COVID-19.

item.title: Task Force PhilHealth submits report to Duterte on September 14
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The multi-agency task force formed to investigate alleged irregularities in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. is expected to submit its recommendations to President Duterte next week.

item.title: Go pushes for stricter health protocols in public places
item.description: To fully “flatten the curve” of COVID-19, Sen. Bong Go called for stricter enforcement of health and safety protocols, especially in public places.

item.title: Duterte: Be vigilant even with flattened COVID-19 curve
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: President Duterte has called on Filipinos to remain vigilant and not be complacent even if the coun- try has shown encouraging results in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: 45% of adult Pinoys internet users — SWS
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Nearly half of the number of adult Filipinos are internet users, according to a Social Weather Stations survey in December last year.

item.title: Duterte: Philippines to get most affordable vaccine
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Philippines will go for the most affordable vaccine available in the market as President Duterte believes there is no difference among the potential immunizations against COVID-19.

item.title: Duterte eyes Spratlys ‘vacation’ with Duque, Americans
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: President Duterte wants to take a vacation somewhere in the country, possibly the Spratlys, and wants to invite Americans to join the tour.“One of these days, magtawag ako ng bakasyon. Bakasyon tayo. Mamili ka sa lugar, Secretary. Huwag lang sa labas ng Pilipinas. Dito lang (I will take a vacation. Let’s have a vacation. Choose a place, Secretary. But not outside the Philippines, let’s just stay here),” Duterte said in a televised public address on Monday night, addressing Health chief Francisco Duque III.
